Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide the following information under the Freedom Of Information Act: -
- The system used by councillors for logging items of casework received from constituents
- The number of casework items entered by each councillor for the years 2022, 2021 and 2020
- The minimum level of public engagement expected by the council from it's councillors
Yours faithfully,
Matt Smith

Dear Matt Smith,
Thank you for your request for information relating to casework which we

The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 30/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact

Yours sincerely,

Dear Matt Smith
We regret the delay in responding to your request of 1 October 2023 which
was due on 30 October 2023. We sincerely apologise for your frustration
and you having to complain to the Information Commissioner’s Office.
Please find below a response to your requests:
- The system used by councillors for logging items of casework received
from constituents
Since 2022, we have used Microsoft One Note; before that we were using
Excel spreadsheets.
- The number of casework items entered by each councillor for the years
2022, 2021 and 2020
The attached list Includes the number of cases raised by individual
Councillors for the period 2022-23, but it should be noted that not all
cases are logged in the Casework system; some Councillors will deal with
cases themselves.
Earlier records are proving difficult to extract from. Both 2020 and 2021
were during Covid lockdown period where staff did not have access to
council systems and individual councillors would therefore have managed
their own casework. Our records are patchy and laborious to extract from
as they are a combination of One Note and Excel spreadsheets. A further
disclosure to you will be made imminently.
- The minimum level of public engagement expected by the council from its
councillors
We refer you to the articles of the constitution relating to Members and
Citizens and the Councillor Code of Conduct to give information which
might be considered relevant. Both are published documents, and these are
the links to the council webpages:
Constitution: Article 2 – Members of the Council:
[1]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/docum...
Article 3 - Citizens & the Council [2]Part 2C - Article 3 - Citizens and
the Council 2022.pdf (sheffield.gov.uk)
Councillor Code of Conduct:
[3]
https://democracy.sheffield.gov.uk/docum...
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [4]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[5]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Matt Smith
Please find the outstanding data for this request regarding the number of
items of case work logged against our councillors for the years 2021-2022.
We do not hold information for 2020, which was a year of lockdowns, when
our inability to access council systems during lockdown when we worked
from home means we can find no data; it is likely that individual
councillors managed their own casework during that year.
The re-use conditions and your rights to complain are as they were in the
partial response we provided yesterday.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
